name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Naples East (I-75)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got the room for 40 a night on Priceline. We were traveling late to the east coast and decided this was the best location to stay, especially for the price. Checkin took about 15 minutes - We got there late at night and the B staff was definitely in.
reviews.title: Not bad for $40

reviews.text: My husband & I stayed @ this particular hotel one night & were very satisfied: room was clean and sleek, and the hotel accepts dogs at no additional cost.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative - the mini-fridge is ancient & very loud when it comes on.
reviews.title: So-So Stay at the LQ

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ended up here getting a great rate courtesy of Hotwire. Hotwire claims this is a 3* property. I disagree. 2.5* tops.
reviews.title: THE WORST!

reviews.text: Yes, it's a LQ, not the Ritz. However, I've stayed at LQs before and they're much better than this location. This property was a Baymont Inn in it's previous life.
reviews.title: Great management and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the way to Miami the first week of December. I was prepared to go to anothr hotel if it wasn't up to my standards. I was very pleased with everything about the hotel. The front desk greeted us with a smile and were very efficient. The room was clean, ammenties in the bathroom and very comfortable. We didn't try the breakfast. I will rethink my opinion on La Quinta after this stay but I still hate the commercials!
reviews.title: very surprised

reviews.text: This is a older property in need of upkeep and renovation.
reviews.title: Thought La Quinta has higher standards
Moderate cost for stay that was very good
reviews.text: Good room, relatively quiet and able to work and plan as necessary for my activities that took place while in Naples. Having the ceiling fan is a really nice features while provides air circulation without the noise of the air conditioner clicking off and on. All appliances worked well and everything was clean.
Typical La Quinta Inn, small hotel with mostly people traveling on the road. A bit noisy for me. Not a great place to stay but you really get what you pay.
reviews.title: What you pay is what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was clean and even though they let dogs stay there was no pet smell. Beds were comfortable, staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Clean!

reviews.text: Excellent stay. Comfortable beds, quiet room. All for a reasonable price. Breakfast is cereal, bread/muffins, waffles, fruit and juice and coffee. Definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and reasonably priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had never stayed at a La Quinta hotel before and decided to try this one as it was late and we didn't want to drive in the dark across I-75 in the Evergaldes. Wow, we should have tried this before. This exceeded our expectations. Everything was just right. Rooms were superb. We felt like sleeping with the TV on because the home channel has a full moon ocean scene with waves sounding in the background, like being on the beach at midnight! We look forward to staying here again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Located 20 minutes from Marco Island and 30 south of the Fort Meyers International Airport, this property is very inexpensive and includes the basics for a breakfast snack. The rooms are quiet but I do recommend a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor since the rooms on the first floor are exposed through the window in the room to the parking lot so for privacy you do not want to leave the curtain open on the first floor. The rooms are average clean for a motel. Parking, of course, is free.
reviews.title: Inexpensive and Functional

reviews.text: Stayed here before - it is conveniently located off the interstate. Tractor trailer parking is on the street next to the hotel but it's not a big deal to walk a few feet to the back entrance. It is a pet friendly hotel and does not charge for pets so I appreciated this savings. We got a room on the first floor and found it to be clean, quiet and comfortable. It was not very expensive and for the price, the room was decent enough. There is no microwave or mini-fridge but they do offer a small coffee maker in the room. Internet was also available. They offered the usual complimentary breakfast fare in the morning and we found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. While you may have to drive to find a decent restaurant, you can be satisfied with a short walk up the street to a McDonald's and the gas station/convenience store. for something to munch on. We were pretty much happy with the place for a one-night stay.
reviews.title: Pretty decent, convenient and quiet.

reviews.text: Close to the Freeway. The hotel looks new from the outside, but the room I had was quite warn. Bathroom was dingy. The bedding was fine, but I could not shake the feeling of it being dirty everywhere else. It could have been the huge stain on the floor in the hallway that looked like a spilled milkshake. I've stayed at La Quinta's elsewhere that were in a much better condition.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: I like this hotel, the staff is super friendly. The only problem I occurred was being in a non smoking room and the whole floor smelling of Marijuana.
reviews.title: Love the friendleness of the staff!

reviews.text: We were just looking for a cheap place to stay overnight on our way to Miami from Clearwater. We decided to stop at Naples for a sunset cruise, then find a cheap hotel before heading over to Miami. This place was just off the freeway and at $40 with free breakfast, seemed a great deal compared to what we'd be paying in the East Side! Well, the bed we got was lumpy and the blankets not so comfy, but it was clean and the front desk attendant was nice. Overall it was a great side trip and I do recommend this stop, if you're a no fuss, low maintenance type a gal.
reviews.title: Was a nice surprise for $40

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely rooms,
reviews.title: Great hotel..we would def. go back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent breakfast
reviews.title: OMG, pass on this hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and fabulous pool.
reviews.title: Overpriced, terrible breakfast, loud AC made sleep difficult

aka: La Quinta Inn & Suites-Naples East (i-75) Hotel Naples
description: NEW! Flat-panel TVs with 30 channels of HD programming. Easy-access Plug-and-Play feature makes it simple to connect electronics.Located just six miles east of downtown Naples and the beautiful white sand beaches, the La Quinta Inn & Suites Naples East (I-75) is the place to stay in southwest Florida. From here, it is not far to the Tin City waterfront shops and restaurants, and to outlet mall shopping only a ...see morefew miles away. Stay here when attending events at Germain Arena, International College, Florida Gulf Coast University, and Edison Community College, only a half mile from here. Physicians Regional Medical Center is 4 miles south & Naples Community Hospital is just 10 miles away. We are just 30 minutes south of South West Florida International Airport and a few minutes away from the Naples Airport. Marco Island, Everglades City & Ava Maria are only 20-30 minutes away. We are also close to attractions such as the Everlgades, Rookery Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve, Conservancy Nature Center, Audubon Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Naples Botanical Gardens, Collier-Seminole State Park, Florida Sports Park, Picayune Strand State Forest, Philharmonic Center for the Arts. Many popular golf courses are minutes away. Start a beautiful Florida morning at the La Quinta Inn & Suites Naples East (I-75) with a delicious Free Bright Side BreakfastTM and a free USA Today in the lobby. All rooms include free high-speed Internet access, a coffee maker ,iron/board, and more. We are pet friendly. There is a heated outdoor pool for your enjoyment and a laundry facility for use at your leisure, plus available fax/copy services at the 24-hour front desk. Bus, RV, and truck parking available
